Title: Series: The Amarna Letters
Description: Clay tablet inscribed in Babylonian cuneiform; letter from the ruler Abdi-tirshi of Hazor to the Egyptian pharaoh Amenhotep III or Amenhotep IV (Akhenaten); 5 + 5?; 25 lines; the writing is complex and parts of many signs are indistinct; part of reverse blank; nearly complete.
Bibliographic references: Knudtzon, J A 1915a / Die El-Amarna Tafeln (228)
Bezold 1892a / The El-Amarna Tablets in the British Museum (48)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.175)
Sigrist M et al 2006a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, III
Associated names: Named in inscription: Abdi-tirshi, Ruler of Hazor
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
